eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting

Class ScaleFactors

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.pivoting.ScaleFactors

  • public class ScaleFactors
extends Object
    Auxiliary class that handles scaling of distances in pivot-based similarity search.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScaleFactors

        public ScaleFactors(MetricReferences R,
                    int m)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        R - Representation of all reference (pivot) values for all distances.
        m - Number of distances (i.e., attributes involved in the index).

    • Method Detail

      • setScale2KNN

        public <T,S extends Geometry,D> void setScale2KNN(Map<String,Map<?,?>> datasets,
                                                  String[] attrIdentifiers,
                                                  Node<T,S> root,
                                                  Point q,
                                                  int k)
        Calculates the scale factors to normalize distance values for the various distances. This method calculates the distance of k-nearest neighbor separately per query attribute value (ignoring the values in the rest).
        Parameters:
        datasets - Dictionary of input datasets used in creating the underlying index.
        attrIdentifiers - Attribute identifiers per distance metric, each corresponding to the input datasets.
        root - Root node of the RR*-tree index that holds the multi-dimensional embeddings of the data points.
        q - The R-dimensional embedding of the query point.
        k - The number of results to return as the top-k most similar to the query.

      • setScale2MaxRange

        public void setScale2MaxRange(double[] mins,
                              double[] maxes)
        Calculates the scale factors to normalize distance values for the various distances. This method uses the range of values per attribute in the data for the normalization.
        Parameters:
        mins - R-dimensional point having as ordinates the minimum values per embedding among all indexed data points.
        maxes - R-dimensional point having as ordinates the maximum values per embedding among all indexed data points.

      • getAll

        public double[] getAll()
        Provides the scale factors (one per distance).
        Returns:
        Array of m double values to be used as denominators when normalizing distance values per distance.

      • get

        public double get(int i)
        Provides the scale factors to be used for the specified distance.
        Parameters:
        i - The i-th distance in the index (associated with an attribute).
        Returns:
        The scale factor to be be used in normalizing distances for the given attribute (distance).
